segments.en: 3. The Explanation of the Hundred and Eight

segments.pli: “‘Imā vedanā’ti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṃ udapādi, ñāṇaṃ udapādi, paññā udapādi, vijjā udapādi, āloko udapādi.
segments.en: “‘These are the feelings.’ Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in me regarding teachings not learned before from another.

segments.pli: ‘Ayaṃ vedanāsamudayo’ti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṃ udapādi … pe … āloko udapādi.
‘Ayaṃ vedanāsamudayagāminī paṭipadā’ti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṃ udapādi … pe …
segments.en: ‘This is the practice that leads to the origin of feeling.’ …

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ vedanānirodho’ti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṃ udapādi … pe …
‘ayaṃ vedanānirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṃ udapādi … pe …
segments.en: ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of feeling.’ …

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ vedanāya assādo’ti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu … pe …
‘ayaṃ vedanāya ādīnavo’ti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu … pe …
‘idaṃ kho nissaraṇan’ti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṃ udapādi, ñāṇaṃ udapādi, paññā udapādi, vijjā udapādi, āloko udapādī”ti.
segments.en: ‘This is the escape from feeling.’ Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in me regarding teachings not learned before from another.”

sections.title: “‘These are the feelings.’ Such was the vision, knowledge,…

suttaplex.blurb: At his awakening, the Buddha saw feeling in terms of arising, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape.
